channel.title: NPR Topics: Economy
channel.description: NPR news on the U.S. and world economy, the World Bank, and Federal Reserve. Commentary on economic trends. Subscribe to NPR Economy podcasts and RSS feeds.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: NPR price-checks 114 items at Walmart
item.description: NPR price-checks 114 items at a Walmart in Georgia to see how costs have changed in a year.
item.content:encoded: NPR price-checks 114 items at a Walmart in Georgia to see how costs have changed in a year.
item.dc:creator: Alina Selyukh

item.title: How have prices changed in a year? NPR checked 114 items at Walmart
item.description: We found the effects of tariffs and extreme weather, relief (finally!) in the egg cooler, plus one case of shrinkflation.
item.content:encoded: We found the effects of tariffs and extreme weather, relief (finally!) in the egg cooler, plus one case of shrinkflation.
item.dc:creator: Alina Selyukh

item.title: Trump says the economy is resurging. Are voters buying it?
item.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with pollster Margie Omero {oh-MARE-oh} about President Trump's record on the economy.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with pollster Margie Omero {oh-MARE-oh} about President Trump's record on the economy.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: Federal Reserve will meet soon to make a decision on interest rates
item.description: The Federal Reserve will meet later this month to make a decision on interest rates. But the latest inflation report is likely to make the central bank cautious about additional rate cuts.
item.content:encoded: The Federal Reserve will meet later this month to make a decision on interest rates. But the latest inflation report is likely to make the central bank cautious about additional rate cuts.
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: Chicago Fed president on latest inflation numbers and Trump's attack on the Fed chair
item.description: Austan Goolsbee, president of the Chicago Federal Reserve Bank, speaks with NPR's A Martinez about the latest inflation numbers and President Trump's attack on Fed Chair Jerome Powell.
item.content:encoded: Austan Goolsbee, president of the Chicago Federal Reserve Bank, speaks with NPR's A Martinez about the latest inflation numbers and President Trump's attack on Fed Chair Jerome Powell.
item.dc:creator: A Mart√≠nez

item.title: China's trade surplus surges 20% to a record $1.2 trillion, even with Trump's tariffs
item.description: China's trade surplus surged to a record of almost $1.2 trillion in 2025, the government said Wednesday, as exports to other countries made up for slowing shipments to the U.S. under President Donald Trump's onslaught of higher tariffs.
item.content:encoded:
China's trade surplus surged to a record of almost $1.2 trillion in 2025, the government said Wednesday, as exports to other countries made up for slowing shipments to the U.S. under President Donald Trump's onslaught of higher tariffs.

(Image credit: CHINATOPIX)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: What Trump's fight with Powell could mean for the Fed's future
item.description: President Trump has been trying to bully the Federal Reserve into cutting interest rates. It's a gambit that could lead to more inflation.
item.content:encoded: President Trump has been trying to bully the Federal Reserve into cutting interest rates. It's a gambit that could lead to more inflation.
item.dc:creator: Henry Larson

item.title: Inflation steadies but it's still higher than many would like
item.description: Inflation didn't get worse in December. But it didn't get better. Prices were up 2.7% a year ago. A drop in gasoline prices was more than offset by rising grocery and electricity bills.
item.content:encoded: Inflation didn't get worse in December. But it didn't get better. Prices were up 2.7% a year ago. A drop in gasoline prices was more than offset by rising grocery and electricity bills.
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: What to know about Trump's ugly feud with the Federal Reserve
item.description: A Justice Department probe of the Federal Reserve marks the latest escalation in the Trump administration's effort to bend the independent central bank to the president's will.
item.content:encoded:
A Justice Department probe of the Federal Reserve marks the latest escalation in the Trump administration's effort to bend the independent central bank to the president's will.

(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla)
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: How IVF has led to a record number of single moms in their 40s
item.description: Who gets to be a parent has been reshaped by IVF: Single women in their 40s are increasingly opting to become moms.
item.content:encoded: Who gets to be a parent has been reshaped by IVF: Single women in their 40s are increasingly opting to become moms.
item.dc:creator: Pallavi Gogoi
